metadata.title: USN-4217-1 -- Samba vulnerabilities
metadata.description: Andreas Oster discovered that the Samba DNS management server incorrectly handled certain records. An authenticated attacker could possibly use this issue to crash Samba, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2019-14861)  Isaac Boukris discovered that Samba did not enforce the Kerberos DelegationNotAllowed feature restriction, contrary to expectations. (CVE-2019-14870)  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-4217-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  libnss-winbind - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.14 libparse-pidl-perl - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.14 samba - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.14 registry-tools - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.14 libpam-winbind - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.14 libsmbclient - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.14 smbclient - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.14 python-samba - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.14 winbind - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.14 samba-testsuite - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.14 samba-common-bin - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.14 libwbclient0 - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.14 libwbclient-dev - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.14 samba-dsdb-modules - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.14 samba-dev - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.14 libsmbclient-dev - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.14 samba-vfs-modules - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.14 samba-common - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.14 samba-libs - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.14 ctdb - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.14 No subscription required
